All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ArtificialPlayer
Represents an artificial (computer-controlled) player capable of generating random moves.
ArtificialPlayerFactory
Factory class for creating artificial players.
Board
Represents a generic rectangular game board composed of tiles.
Connect4
Handles the logic of a Connect4 game, including player moves and board display.
Connect4Factory
Factory class for creating Connect4 game instances.
ConsoleColors
Utility class that defines ANSI escape codes for coloring console output.
Fr
Contains the different texts to display
Game
Abstract base class for all board-based games.
GameController
Handles user input and controls the overall flow of the game.
GameFactory
Abstract gamefactory class for creating game instances.
GameFileRepository
Handles persistence operations for saving and loading game data such as players and boards.
GameSerialization
Implements the Persistence interface using Java object serialization.
Gomoku
Handles the logic of a Gomoku game, including player moves and board display.
GomokuFactory
Factory class for creating Gomoku game instances.
HumanPlayer
Represents a human player in the game.
HumanPlayerFactory
Factory class for creating human players.

PersistenceController
Handles persistence operations between the application and the storage layer.
Player
Represents a player in a board game with a specific symbol and color.
PlayerFactory
Abstract factory class for creating players.
RandomCoordinateCapable
Defines a contract for objects capable of generating a random coordinate to play.
